CatDescriptText: Miss Vera B. Duskins, dietitian, 7184 Tilden Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "I do. If circumstances are so miserable and the couple so unhappy, they should separate.  Everybody is entitled to some happiness, and what happiness can you have without the opposite sex?"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vera B. Duskins holding National Record Mart paper bag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
